source.its:locQualityIssueComment: Translation is the same as the source.

trans-unit.source: Rome is the capital city of Italy.

seg-source.mrk: Rome is the capital city of Italy.

target.mrk: Rome is the capital city of Italy.

trans-unit.source: It is also the country's largest and most populated comune and fourth-most populous city in the European Union by population within city limits. The city is located in the central-western portion of the Italian Peninsula, on the Tiber River within the Lazio region of Italy.

seg-source.mrk: It is also the country's largest and most populated comune and fourth-most populous city in the European Union by population within city limits.
The city is located in the central-western portion of the Italian Peninsula, on the Tiber River within the Lazio region of Italy.

target.mrk: It is also the country's largest and most populated comune and fourth-most populous city in the European Union by population within city limits.
The city is located in the central-western portion of the Italian Peninsula, on the Tiber River within the Lazio region of Italy.

trans-unit.source: Rome enjoys a Mediterranean climate (Csa in Köppen climate classification) with mild, humid winters and warm, dry summers.

seg-source.mrk: Rome enjoys a Mediterranean climate (Csa in Köppen climate classification) with mild, humid winters and warm, dry summers.

target.mrk: Rome enjoys a Mediterranean climate (Csa in Köppen climate classification) with mild, humid winters and warm, dry summers.
